maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the list of sites from the Azure Site Recovery vault.
The Get-AzureRmSiteRecoverySite cmdlet retrieves the list of Hyper-V sites in the Azure Site Recovery vault.
Friendly name of the site to be created
Name of the site to be created
Friendly name of the site to be created
Name of the site to be created
Get information about Azure Site Recovery servers registered to the current Azure Site Recovery vault.
The Get-AzureRmSiteRecoveryServer cmdlet gets information about Azure Site Recovery servers registered to the current Azure Site Recovery vault.
FriendlyName of the Server
Name of the Server
FriendlyName of the Server
Name of the Server
Gets a list of protectable or protected entities, such as virtual machines, in the current Site Recovery vault
The Get-AzureRmSiteRecoveryProtectionEntity cmdlet gets a list of protectable or protected entities, such as virtual machines, in the current Site Recovery vault
Protection Container object

Protection Container object

Gets a list of Azure Site Recovery(ASR) vaults or a specific ASR vault from the current subscription
The Get-AzureRmSiteRecoveryVault gets a list of Azure Site Recovery(ASR) vaults or a specific ASR vault from the current subscription
The name of the vault to be queried for.
The name of the Azure Resource group in which to create or from which to retrieve the specified recovery services object.

Allows user to download the Azure Site Recovery Vault Settings File
The Get-AzureRmSiteRecoveryVaultSettingsFile cmdlet gets the settings file for an Azure Site Recovery vault.
Vault Object for which the site list is to be fetched
Path to the Azure site Recovery Vault Settings file. This file can be downloaded from Azure Site Recovery Vault portal and stored locally
The site friendly name if the vault credentials are to be downloaded for a Hyper-V site
The site identifier if the vault credentials are to be downloaded for a Hyper-V site
Vault Object for which the site list is to be fetched
Path to the Azure site Recovery Vault Settings file. This file can be downloaded from Azure Site Recovery Vault portal and stored locally

Vault Object for which the site list is to be fetched
Retrieves information regarding the the active Azure Site Recovery Vault
The Get-AzureRmSiteRecoveryVaultSettings cmdlet gets settings information regarding the active Azure Site Recovery vault.
Get information about Azure Site Recovery Network mappings for current Azure Site Recovery Vault
The Get-AzureRmSiteRecoveryNetworkMapping cmdlet gets information about Azure Site Recovery Network mappings for current Azure Site Recovery Vault
switch parameter "Azure"

Get information about Networks managed by Azure Site Recovery for the current Azure Site Recovery Vault.
The Get-AzureRmSiteRecoveryNetwork cmdlet gets information about Azure Site Recovery Networks for the current Azure Site Recovery Vault.

Get the information of the operation for current Azure Site Recovery Vault.
The Get-AzureRmSiteRecoveryJob cmdlet gets Microsoft Azure Site Recovery jobs. You can use this cmdlet to view the information of the operation for current Azure Site Recovery vault.
Unique Name (identifier) that identifies the job

Specifies a end time as a DateTime object. This cmdlet gets jobs that starts before the time that this parameter specifies. To obtain a DateTime object, use the Get-Date cmdlet. For more information, type Get-Help Get-Date.

Specifies a start time as a DateTime object. This cmdlet gets jobs that begin after the time that this parameter specifies. To obtain a DateTime object, use the Get-Date cmdlet. For more information, type Get-Help Get-Date.
Specifies an input state for an Azure Site Recovery job. This cmdlet gets jobs that match the state that this parameter specifies.
ID of the object on which Job was targeted to.

Specifies a end time as a DateTime object. This cmdlet gets jobs that starts before the time that this parameter specifies. To obtain a DateTime object, use the Get-Date cmdlet. For more information, type Get-Help Get-Date.
Unique Name (identifier) that identifies the job

Specifies a start time as a DateTime object. This cmdlet gets jobs that begin after the time that this parameter specifies. To obtain a DateTime object, use the Get-Date cmdlet. For more information, type Get-Help Get-Date.
Specifies an input state for an Azure Site Recovery job. This cmdlet gets jobs that match the state that this parameter specifies.
ID of the object on which Job was targeted to.

Gets protection containers for the current Microsoft Azure Site Recovery vault. A protection container is a logical container for protected objects such as virtual machines. Protection policies define replication settings for protected items and can be associated to a Protection container and applied to a protected entity
The Get-AzureRmSiteRecoveryProtectionContainer cmdlet gets protection containers for the current Microsoft Azure Site Recovery vault.
Friendly name of the Protection Container
Name of the Protection Container
Friendly name of the Protection Container
Name of the Protection Container
Gets the list of configured Site Recovery Protection Policies or a specific Site Recovery protection policy specified by name
The Get-AzureRmSiteRecoveryPolicy cmdlet gets the list of configured Site Recovery Protection Policies or a specific Site Recovery protection policy specified by name
Friendly name of the Azure Site Recovery replication policy
Name of the Azure Site Recovery replication policy
Friendly name of the Azure Site Recovery replication policy
Name of the Azure Site Recovery replication policy
Imports an Azure site Recovery Vault Settings file to set the vault context for subsequent ASR operations in the current session.
The Import-AzureRmSiteRecoveryVaultSettingsFile cmdlet imports an Azure site Recovery Vault Settings file to set the vault context for subsequent ASR operations in the current session.
Path to the Azure site Recovery Vault Settings file. This file can be downloaded from Azure Site Recovery Vault portal and stored locally
Path to the Azure site Recovery Vault Settings file. This file can be downloaded from Azure Site Recovery Vault portal and stored locally
Creates an Azure Site Recovery Site
The New-AzureRmSiteRecoverySite cmdlet creates a new Azure Site Recovery Site in the current vault
Name of the site to be created
Name of the site to be created
Creates a new site recovery services vault
The New-AzureRmSiteRecoveryVault cmdlet creates a new site recovery services vault
Geo Location Name
Name of the vault to be created

Geo Location Name

The name of the Azure Resource group in which to create or from which to retrieve the specified recovery services object.
Creates a mapping between two Virtual Networks and returns an ASR Job to track it
The New-AzureRMSiteRecoveryNetworkMapping cmdlet creates a mapping between two Virtual Networks.
Azure virtual network id
Primary Network object

Create a site recovery replication policy. The replication policy is used to specify replication settings such as replication frequency, number of recovery points etc.
The New-AzureRmSiteRecoveryPolicy cmdlet lets you create a site recovery replication policy
Provide a friendly name to identify the Azure Site Recovery replication policy
Replication frequency interval in seconds. As of now, only three possible values supported. 30 seconds, 300 seconds, 900 seconds.
Frequency of Application Consistent Snapshot in hours.
Bypasses confirmation on passing
ID of the Azure storage account to replicate to.
Number of hours to retain Recovery points.
Replication Start Time. It should be within the next 24 hours of the start of the job.
Provide a friendly name to identify the Azure Site Recovery replication policy
Replication frequency interval in seconds. As of now, only three possible values supported. 30 seconds, 300 seconds, 900 seconds.
Port on which the replication would take place.
Switch parameter indicating whether replica entity deletion is to be enabled.
Frequency of Application Consistent Snapshot in hours.
Type of authentication to be used. Possible values are Certificate and Kerberos.
Switch parameter indicating whether compression is to be Enabled.
Bypasses confirmation on passing
Number of hours to retain Recovery points.
Replication Method either Online - over the network or Offline.
Replication Start Time. It should be within the next 24 hours of the start of the job.
Switch parameter indicating whether replica entity deletion is to be enabled.
Frequency of Application Consistent Snapshot in hours.
Type of authentication to be used. Possible values are Certificate and Kerberos.
Switch parameter indicating whether compression is to be Enabled.
Bypasses confirmation on passing
Provide a friendly name to identify the Azure Site Recovery replication policy
ID of the Azure storage account to replicate to.
Number of hours to retain Recovery points.
Replication frequency interval in seconds. As of now, only three possible values supported. 30 seconds, 300 seconds, 900 seconds.
Replication Method either Online - over the network or Offline.
Port on which the replication would take place.
Replication Start Time. It should be within the next 24 hours of the start of the job.
Delete an Azure Recovery Site from the vault
The Remove-AzureRMSiteRecoverySite cmdlet deletes an Azure Recovery Site from the vault

The Remove-AzureRMSiteRecoveryVault cmdlet deletes a site recovery vault

The Remove-AzureRMSiteRecoveryServer cmdlet unregisters a server from the current vault

Removes a Network mapping for the current Azure Site Recovery Vault
The Remove-AzureRMSiteRecoveryNetworkMapping cmdlet removes a network mapping from the current Azure Site Recovery Vault

Deletes a configured replication policy
The Remove-AzureRMSiteRecoveryPolicy cmdlet lets you delete a replication policy

Restarts the operation in Azure Site Recovery
The Restart-AzureRmSiteRecoveryJob cmdlet lets you restart an Azure Site Recovery Job

Resumes a suspended job in Azure site Recovery
The Resume-AzureRmSiteRecoveryJob resumes a suspended job in Azure site Recovery

Set or update recovery side options for an entity that is being protected to Azure
The Set-AzureRmSiteRecoveryVM cmdlet lets you set or update recovery side options such as recovery VM size and recovery VM network for entities being protected to Azure
Virtual Machine object
Name of the target Virtual Machine
Nic properties set by user or set by default
Primary NIC
Recovery Network ID
Static IP address that should be assigned to primary NIC on recovery
Azure virtual network subnet name to which the primary NIC should be attached on recovery
Target size, should be limited to set of values of Azure VM sizes

The Set-AzureRmSiteRecoveryProtectionEntity cmdlet enables or disables protection on a protection entity

Initiates a dissociation job on the replication policy associated with protection containers.
The Start-AzureRmSiteRecoveryPolicyDissociationJob cmdlet initiates a dissociation job on the replication policy associated with a protection container.
Azure Site recovery policy object
Gets or sets Primary Protection Container to be applied the Protection Profile settings on.

Starts the test failover for a protection entity or for a recovery plan in Microsoft Azure Site Recovery.
The Start-AzureRmSiteRecoveryTestFailoverJob cmdlet starts test failover of a protection entity or recovery plan. Check whether the job succeeds by using the Get-AzureRmSiteRecoveryJob cmdlet
Direction of the failover, either PrimaryToRecovery or RecoveryToPrimary

Starts the unplanned failover for a protected entity or for a recovery plan in Microsoft Azure Site Recovery.

The Start-AzureRmSiteRecoveryUnplannedFailoverJob cmdlet starts unplanned failover of a protection entity or recovery plan. Check whether the job succeeds by using the Get-AzureRmSiteRecoveryJob cmdlet
Direction of the failover, either PrimaryToRecovery or RecoveryToPrimary
Protection Entity object
Its used for indicating whether can do source site operations.

Start the commit failover of the Azure Site Recovery object after failover
The Start-AzureRmSiteRecoveryCommitFailoverJob cmdlet starts commit failover of an Azure Site Recovery object after a failover operation
Protection Entity object
Direction of the commit, either PrimaryToRecovery or RecoveryToPrimary
Direction of the commit, either PrimaryToRecovery or RecoveryToPrimary
Protection Entity object
Start the Planned Failover operation for a Protection Entity or Recovery Plan under Azure Site Recovery
The Start-AzureRmSiteRecoveryPlannedFailoverJob cmdlet starts planned failover of a protection entity or recovery plan. Check whether the job succeeds by using the Get-AzureRmSiteRecoveryJob cmdlet
Direction of the failover, either PrimaryToRecovery or RecoveryToPrimary
Protection Entity object

This parameter is applicable when Failover is done from Azure to on-premise site which requires a large data synchronization. Specify what synchronization has to optimize: ForDowntime: Synchronize data before failover (minimize downtime) Synchronization will be performed without shutting down the virtual machine. After synchronization is complete, the job would be suspended. Resume the job to do an additional synchronization that shuts down the virtual machine. ForSynchronization : data during failover only (minimize synchronization) With this setting enabled, the virtual machine will begin shutdown immediately. Synchronization will start after shutdown to complete the failover.
Direction of the failover, either PrimaryToRecovery or RecoveryToPrimary

This parameter is applicable when Failover is done from Azure to on-premise site which requires a large data synchronization. Specify what synchronization has to optimize: ForDowntime: Synchronize data before failover (minimize downtime) Synchronization will be performed without shutting down the virtual machine. After synchronization is complete, the job would be suspended. Resume the job to do an additional synchronization that shuts down the virtual machine. ForSynchronization : data during failover only (minimize synchronization) With this setting enabled, the virtual machine will begin shutdown immediately. Synchronization will start after shutdown to complete the failover.
Protection Entity object

The Start-AzureRmSiteRecoveryPolicyAssociationJob cmdlet initiates an association job to associate a replication policy with a protection container.
